docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic Rep. Ami Bera has been making a habit lately of bucking his own president and voting with the Republican majority in the House as it moves to amend or overturn parts of the national health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: By Thanksgiving, it was clear that Kathleen Sebelius, the departing Health and Human Services secretary, would eventually have to go.

headline.main: Sebelius’s Slow-Motion Resignation From the Cabinet
headline.print_headline: A Slow-Motion Resignation From the Cabinet

docs.abstract: Kathleen Sebelius's path to resignation as secretary of Health and Human Services became clear as far back as Thanksgiving, as White House was overwhelmed by fallout from health care website debacle; Obama administration lost confidence in Sebelius as problems with website mounted, attacks from Republicans increased and Democrats facing reelection called for a change in management.
docs.snippet: By Thanksgiving, it was clear that Kathleen Sebelius, the departing Health and Human Services secretary, would eventually have to go.

docs.lead_paragraph: Texas is reconsidering whether to impose strict limits on Gilead Sciences' $84,000 hepatitis C treatment for patients on the state's Medicaid health plan for the poor, at the urging of outside advisers, a state official said on Friday.
